intro: Xyris gymnoptera, commonly known as the naked-petioled yellow-eyed grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Xyridaceae, which includes various species of grass-like plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces bright yellow flowers in late spring to early summer. Its flowers are typically arranged in spikes and are pollinated by insects. Xyris gymnoptera is adapted to wetland environments and thrives in moist, acidic soils.
